comments:

!SUBENTRY 1 org.eclipse.core.resources 4 368 2006-01-12 12:55:33.255
!MESSAGE Resource /P02/src/F.java does not exist.

This seems to happen for every move.

The code that logs is WorkbenchFile(WorkbenchResource).testContentTypeProperty(IResource, String) line: 163

In the scenario, the refactoring has just finished, but the package viewer has not yet refreshed (we currently post the refresh with 'async exec', planed to change), so the old element is still is around.

I think the bug is that WorkbenchFile(WorkbenchResource).testContentTypeProperty logs. If a file doesn not exist, the test should return false.

Kim, this is in the content type tester.  Would you be able to look at it?
Note that the corresponding code in core.resources' ResourcePropertyTester should be fixed up similarly.
*** Bug 127034 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
